verses.text: 以下是對尼尼微的宣判，就是伊勒歌斯人那鴻的異象錄。

words.note: Person from Elkosh
Lit. 'unusual image'

verses.heading: Introduction

verses.text: 神耶和華是嫉惡和施行報復的 神；耶和華施行報復，並且滿懷烈怒；耶和華向他的對頭施行報復，向他的仇敵懷怒。

words.note: The space indicates reverence for God's name.
The space indicates reverence for God's name.

verses.heading: God Takes Vengeance against His Enemies

verses.text: 耶和華不輕易發怒，可是大有能力；他絕不以有罪的為無罪。耶和華乘著狂風暴雨而來，雲彩是他腳下的塵土。
他一斥責海，海就乾了；他使一切江河枯乾。巴珊和迦密的樹林枯槁，黎巴嫩的花卉凋殘。

words.note: Often used in '一...就...' structure
Often used in '一...就...' structure

verses.heading: The Divine Warrior Destroys His Enemies but Protects His People

verses.text: 大山在他面前震動，小山也都融化；大地在他面前廢去，世界和所有住在世上的，也都這樣。
在他盛怒之下，誰能站得住呢？他的烈怒誰能受得了呢？他的忿怒像火一般噴出來，磐石在他面前都崩裂了。

words.note: Refers to a powerful, overflowing anger.
Often found in classical Chinese or formal/biblical texts.
Similar to 盛怒, emphasizing intensity and heat.
Often used interchangeably with 憤怒 (fènnù).
Often symbolizing stability or God in the Bible.

verses.text: 耶和華是良善的；在患難的時候，他作人的避難所；信靠他的人，他都認識。

words.note: A key attribute of God in the Bible.
Refers to severe hardship or suffering.
A place of safety from danger.
A core concept in religious faith.

verses.text: 但他必用氾濫的洪水，盡行毀滅尼尼微之地，把他的仇敵趕入黑暗之中。

words.note: A significant biblical event.
Often used with verbs like 毀滅 (destroy) to emphasize totality.

verses.text: 尼尼微人哪，你們對耶和華還有甚麼企圖？他必盡行毀滅；患難必不再次來臨。
verses.heading: Denunciation and Destruction of Nineveh

verses.text: 他們像纏結著的荊棘，像喝醉了的酒徒，又像枯乾的禾秸，全都被吞滅了。

words.note: Common imagery in biblical texts for hardship or curse.
Often represents something worthless or easily destroyed in the Bible.
Implies complete destruction or annihilation.

verses.text: 有人從你那裡出來，就是籌劃奸惡的人，圖謀惡事攻擊耶和華。

words.note: Often implies negative plotting in this context.
Often implies malicious scheming.

verses.text: 耶和華這樣說：尼尼微人雖然裝備完整，人數眾多，他們仍必被剪除，這樣就完了。我既然使你受過苦，就一定不再叫你受苦了。

words.note: Refers to being utterly eliminated.
Verb-object compound meaning 'suffer'.

verses.heading: Oracle of Deliverance to Judah

verses.text: 猶大啊！現在我必粉碎他在你身上的軛，打斷你的鎖鍊。

words.note: A wooden bar, often symbol of oppression.
Often used metaphorically for bondage.

verses.text: 尼尼微啊！耶和華已經向你下了命令：你的名字必不再傳於後世；我必從你的神廟中，除掉雕刻和鑄造的偶像；我必為你預備墳墓，因為你沒有存在的價值。

words.note: Often used with '命令' (command) to mean 'issued'.
Combines '傳' (transmit) with classical preposition '於'.
Can be verb 'to carve' or adjective 'carved'.
Can be verb 'to cast' or adjective 'cast/molded'.

verses.heading: Oracle of Judgment against the King of Nineveh

verses.text: 看哪！那傳報佳音、宣告和平之人的腳，已經站在山上，說：猶大啊！守你的節期，還你的願吧！因為那奸惡的人永不會再從你中間經過；他已被徹底除滅了。

words.note: Often used to draw attention in scripture.
Equivalent to '福音' (gospel).
Has significant theological meaning in the Bible.
Literary equivalent of '的'.
Often used for complete destruction of enemies or evil.
Refers to the authoritative Hebrew Bible text.

verses.heading: Proclamation of the Deliverance of Judah
